Entity.description: Master table for all biological entities (gene, variant, protein, etc).

EntityName.description: Aliases and alternate names for entities.

EntityRelation.description: Relationships between two entities (e.g., Gene â†” Protein).

Gene.description: Gene master table with HGNC, Entrez, Ensembl identifiers, linked to entity and functional categories.

GeneGroupMembership.description: Many-to-many relationship between Gene and GeneGroup.

GeneLocation.description: Stores genomic coordinates for each gene (e.g., chromosome, start, end, strand).

GeneGenomicRegion.description: Cytogenetic band or chromosomal region associated with a gene (e.g., 1p36.33).

GeneLocusGroup.description: Locus groups as defined by HGNC (e.g., 'RNA genes', 'Pseudogenes').

GeneLocusType.description: Locus types as defined by HGNC (e.g., 'protein-coding gene', 'miRNA').

Variant.description: Genetic variants (SNPs, indels) with position, alleles, and reference assembly.

VariantGeneRelationship.description: Links between variants and genes, with data source tracking.

Protein.description: Protein information extracted from UniProt, linked to genes and Pfam domains.

ProteinPfam.description: Pfam domain metadata including accession, ID, and descriptions.

ProteinPfamLink.description: Many-to-many links between proteins and Pfam domains.

Pathway.description: Biological pathway definitions, integrated from Reactome and KEGG.

OmicStatus.description: Optional status annotation applied to genes (e.g., 'Manually curated').

SystemConfig.description: Key-value storage for system-wide configurations and tunable parameters.

BiofilterMetadata.description: Versioning metadata for schema and ETL processes; includes optional build hash.

GenomeAssembly.description: Reference genome assemblies and their accessions (e.g., GRCh38.p14).
